sections.text1: From the mid-19th century till the outbreak of the Second World War, developments in Hong Kong were mainly along Victoria Harbour, focusing around "Victoria City" on Hong Kong Island and gradually expanding to Kowloon and the New Kowloon. In 1939, the Town Planning Ordinance was enacted to establish a legal and procedural framework for town planning development.
sections.cover:
From the mid-19th century till the outbreak of the Second World War, developments in Hong Kong were mainly along Victoria Harbour, focusing around "Victoria City" on Hong Kong Island and gradually expanding to Kowloon and the New Kowloon.
In 1939, the Town Planning Ordinance was enacted to establish a legal and procedural framework for town planning development.

text.content: In 1860, the Government began to construct the first reservoir in Hong Kong, Pok Fu Lam Reservoir. Leveraging on the topography of Pok Fu Lam Valley, it collects rainwater from a dam and supplies water to Hong Kong Island. The project was completed in 1863.

In 1869, the Government granted a piece of land on Po Yan Street in Sheung Wan to establish the first Chinese hospital in Hong Kong, Tung Wah Hospital. In 1872, the Hospital commenced operation to provide free Chinese medicial services to the sick and poor.

gallery.reference: Source: Hong Kong Museum of History

text.content: In 1890, the Hongkong Electric Company Limited built the first power plant in Hong Kong on the hillside near Wing Fung Street in Wan Chai, which provided electricity for street lamps from Central to Bonham Strand East. In 1919, the North Point Power Station was opened, and the Wan Chai power plant became a reserve station until it was closed down and demolished in 1922.

In 1906, the construction works of the Kowloon-Canton Railway (British Section) project commenced and operation started in 1910. This is the first railway link connecting Hong Kong and Mainland China, with a length of 35 km, including 5 tunnels and 48 bridges.
In 1911, the Canton-Kowloon Railway (China Section) was opened, and the through train service from Kowloon to Guangzhou commenced operation.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

text.content:
In 1912, the Chinese businessmen Ho Kai and Au Tak formed a company to reclaim land in Kowloon Bay and planned to build residential development. The reclamation area was named after the company
name "Kai Tak". Subsequently, the company was closed down due to economic recession, leaving the land vacant. The Government then bought back the land for airport construction. In 1930, the Kai Tak Airport commenced operation.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

text.content: In 1939, the Government enacted the "Town Planning Ordinance".  The Ordinance makes provision for the Town Planning Board to systematically prepare and approve plans for the layout of areas of Hong Kong as well as for the types of building suitable for erection therein and for the preparation and approval of plans for areas within which permission is required for development to promote the health, safety, convenience and general welfare of the community.

image.description: Enactment of the Town Planning Ordinance

sections.text1: Post-war developments were filled with challenges, and the Government commissioned a consultant to formulate the first long-term development strategy for Hong Kong. In the early 1950s, an influx of Mainland immigrants moved to Hong Kong, posing substantial housing demand. The Shek Kip Mei Fire has catalysed the Government’s initiative to develop the first batch of public housing estates to improve the living environment.
sections.cover: Post-war developments were filled with challenges, and the Government commissioned a consultant to formulate the first long-term development strategy for Hong Kong. In the early 1950s, an influx of Mainland immigrants moved to Hong Kong, posing substantial housing demand. The Shek Kip Mei Fire has catalysed the Government’s initiative to develop the first batch of public housing estates to improve the living environment.

text.content: After World War II, the Government re-plan the development of Kowloon to the south of Boundary Street: Tsim Sha Tsui as a commercial and cultural centre; Ho Man Tin Hill in the middle part as a residential cluster; and Yau Ma Tei and Tai Kok Tsui in the west were reserved for high density residential and industrial developments with public facilities such as hospitals, fire stations, etc.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

text.content:
In 1947, the Public Works Department established a Town Planning Office dedicated for town planning matters. After several rounds of organisational
re-structuring, in 1990, the Government consolidated the scattered functions of town planning to establish the Planning Department, responsible for preparation of various types of plans, formulation of land use guidelines and provision of services to the Town Planning Broad.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

text.content: In 1948, the Government's consultant Abercrombie published the "Hong Kong Preliminary Planning Report". This is Hong Kong's first planning blueprint with development strategy, proposing suggestions to address particularly the two-pronged problems of land shortage and rising population.

On the Christmas night of 1953, fire ravaged the squatter area in Shek Kip Mei and over 53,000 people were made homeless. To address the housing problem, the Government initiated to build resettlement blocks for the victims and other squatter dwellers. By the end of 1954, the first eight resettlement blocks (Mark I) were completed in Shek Kip Mei as the first batch of </br>public housing.

image.description: The First Batch of Public Housing

text.content:
After World War II, the economic focus of Hong Kong has shifted from entrepot trade to light industries.
In 1954, Kwun Tong started developing into
Hong Kong's first satellite town with industrial and residential areas; not only accommodating the rising population but also providing larbour force to the nearby industrial area.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service
Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

sections.text1: In the 1950s and 1960s, the manufacturing industry flourished. The Government further developed infrastructural facilities, including the Lion Rock Tunnel and Dongjiang Waterworks. In the 1970s, the Government launched the "Ten-year Housing Programme" to build a large number of public housing developments and develop new towns, and continued to expand the transportation network. The opening of the Mass Transit Railway services in 1979 marked the beginning of mass transportation system.
sections.cover: In the 1950s and 1960s, the manufacturing industry flourished. The Government further developed infrastructural facilities, including the Lion Rock Tunnel and Dongjiang Waterworks. In the 1970s, the <nobr>Government launched the "Ten-year Housing Programme"</nobr> to build a large number of public housing developments and develop new towns, and continued to expand the transportation network. The opening of the Mass Transit Railway services in 1979 marked the beginning of mass transportation system.

text.content:
In 1963, Hong Kong had serious shortage of fresh water. The Governments of Hong Kong and Guangdong Province agreed to implement the Dongjiang-Shenzhen Water Supply Scheme, and the first phase of the project was completed in 1965. Dongjiang water flows 80 km afar into Yantian Reservoir and Shenzhen Reservoir, routes through a 3 km steel viaduct and reaches Muk Wu Water Pumping Station at
Hong Kong boundary.

Between 1967 and 1978, Wah Fu Estate located in the southern district of Hong Kong Island was completed by phases. Wah Fu Estate is the first public housing estate planned in Hong Kong based on the concept of a self-sustainable community. The Estate has shopping complexes, schools, bus terminus, and other community facilities.

gallery.reference: Source: Public Records Office, Government Records Service

text.content: In 1972, the Government announced the "Ten-year Housing Programme" and established the Hong Kong Housing Authority in 1973, which not only take care of all resettlement blocks and low-cost housing estates but also uphold the responsibility of implementing the public housing programme.

The 1948 "Hong Kong Preliminary Planning Report" proposed to construct a cross harbour tunnel to connect the city centres of Hong Kong and Kowloon, to strengthen the transport network from the city centres to the New Territories, and to expand the extent of the urban area.
In 1972, the first cross-harbour tunnel crossing - Hung Hom Cross Harbour Tunnel commenced operation. In 1989 and 1997, the second and third cross harbour tunnels also started operation respectively.

Hong Kong has developed into a regional transport and logistics hub, leveraging on its premier geographical location and it role as the gateway to the Pearl River Delta. In 1972, Kwai Chung Container Terminal 1 was put into operation. In 1976, it was expanded to Container Terminal 5. Container Terminals 6 to 8 were progressively completed before 1997. There are currently nine terminals in Kwai Chung Container Terminals, which can handle more than 20 million TEUs each year.

In 1973, the Government launched the New Town Development Programme. The first generation new towns - Tsuen Wan, Sha Tin, and Tuen Mun commenced works in the early 1970s. The second generation new towns are Tai Po, Fanling/Sheung Shui, and Yuen Long; and the third generation includes Tseung Kwan O, Tin Shui Wai, and Tung Chung. In 2019, the total population of the nine new towns was approximately 3.52 million.

In 1976, the "Country Parks Ordinance" was enacted to provide a legal framework for the establishment of the Country and Marine Parks Board, as well as the designation, development and management of country parks and special areas. The Country Parks Ordinance, together with the Marine Parks Ordinance enacted in 1995, are the milestone for conservation of
Hong Kong’s countryside and marine nature.

In 1978, Hong Kong's first industrial estate, Tai Po Industrial Estate, was completed. The Estate provides comprehensively developed industrial land for companies which cannot operate in multi-storey factories or commercial buildings and those with new or improved technologies.

Since the 1960s, Hong Kong's economy has started to grow. The Government needed to holistically review the long-term land use and population distribution. In 1965, the Government began formulating the "Colony Outline Plan" to comprehensively review the long-term land use <nobr>and population distribution of Hong Kong. Subsequently,</nobr> based on the contemporary socio-economic conditions and development priorities, the Plan was substantially revised and was renamed as "Hong Kong Outline Plan" in 1979.

In 1979, the first phase of the modified initial system, which is part of the current Kwun Tong Line, came into operation by phases, earmarking the advent of mass transit transport system in Hong Kong.  In 2007, the Mass Transit Railway Corporation and Kowloon-Canton Railway Corporation were merged as the MTR Corporation Limited.

sections.text1: In the late 1980s, the Hong Kong Airport Core Programme was announced, providing an important foundation for airport, transport network and urban developments over the next decades. The urban core was closely linked up with New Territories West and Lantau Island. In the early 1990s, the Metroplan was endorsed with highways and railways serving as backbone. In 1998, the Hong Kong International Airport at Chek Lap Kok commenced operation, fostering economic development in Hong Kong.
sections.cover: In the late 1980s, the Hong Kong Airport Core Programme was announced, providing an important foundation for airport, transport network and urban developments over the next decades. The urban core was closely linked up with New Territories West and Lantau Island. In the early 1990s, the Metroplan was endorsed with highways and railways serving as backbone. In 1998, the Hong Kong International Airport at Chek Lap Kok commenced operation, fostering economic development in Hong Kong.

text.content:
In 1984, the Government promulgated the "Territorial Development Strategy" to provide a land use-transport development framework for 1999 to 2001, with the development focus shifted from new towns to the Metro Area on both sides of the Harbour and with highways and railways forming the backbone of the
city development.

In 1987, the Government enacted the "Land Development Corporation Ordinance", and the Land Development Corporation was established in 1988 to implement urban renewal project by adopting a prudent commercial principle as well as to encourage private developers to participate in urban renewal initiatives through public-private partnership.

image.description: Establishment of the Land Development Corporation

text.content: In 1989, the Government promulgated the "Port and Airport Development Strategy", setting out the broadbrush long-term planning framework for port and airport development in Hong Kong. Relevant projects included the Hong Kong Airport Core Programme (also known as the "Rose Garden Project") and Chek Lap Kok in Lantau Island was identified as the location for constructing the new Hong Kong International Airport.

In 1990, the Planning Department was established under the then Planning, Environment and Lands Branch. The Planning Department has consolidated the planning functions previously undertaken by the Town Planning Division, Strategic Planning Unit, and various offices under the Territory Development Department, and upholding the mission to make Hong Kong a better place to live and work.

With the enactment of the "Town Planning (Amendment) Ordinance", the enforcement power of the Planning Department has been strengthened. The Planning Department has been empowered to take enforcement actions against unauthorised developments within Development Permission Areas to prevent further degradation of the environment in rural New Territories.

image.description: Amendments to the Town Planning Ordinance

text.content: In 1995, about 1,500 hectares of wetland in the Mai Po and Inner Deep Bay region were enlisted as a Ramsar <nobr>Site. This piece of wetland is very important for migratory</nobr> birds, and is a wintering ground and refueling station for them flying from Russia in the Arctic to Australia.

gallery.reference: Source: Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department

text.content: In 1995, the Government enacted the "Marine Parks Ordinance" with the aim to protect and conserve the marine environment and the diverse aquatic fauna and flora. In 1996, the Government designated Hoi Ha Wan Marine Park and Yau Chau Tong Marine Park in the eastern marine district.

gallery.reference: Source: Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department

text.content: The "Protection of the Harbour Ordinance" enacted in 1997 and was subsequently amended aims to protect and preserve the harbour by establishing a presumption against reclamation in the harbour.

In 1997, the Government commissioned the "Study on Sustainable Development for the 21st Century in
Hong Kong" to formulate the definition and guiding principles of "sustainable development", and to propose a governance structure to facilitate the incorporation of "sustainable development" into the government decision making process as a factor
of consideration.

In 1996, the Government completed the "Territorial Development Strategy Review". The report, which was promulgated in 1998, suggested to study the development potential of North West New Territories, North East New Territories, Hong Kong Island South and Lamma Island to address the increasing
housing demand.

sections.text1: Under the emerging global economic trends, Hong Kong was facing new challenges. In 2007, the Government promulgated "Hong Kong 2030: Planning Vision and Strategy", proposing a planning strategy which focus on providing a quality living environment, enhancing economic competitiveness, and strengthening links with the Mainland. Looking ahead, Hong Kong is committed to develop into a more liveable, competitive and sustainable "Asia's World City".
sections.cover: Under the emerging global economic trends, Hong Kong was facing new challenges. In 2007, the Government promulgated "Hong Kong 2030: Planning Vision and Strategy", proposing a planning strategy which focus on providing a quality living environment, enhancing economic competitiveness, and strengthening links with the Mainland. Looking ahead, Hong Kong is committed to develop into a more liveable, competitive and sustainable "Asia's World City".

text.content: In 1986, the Government formulated the sewerage strategy and "Sewerage Master Plans". In 2001, Stage 1 of the "Harbour Area Treatment Scheme" commenced operation. Stage 2A also commenced operation in 2015, providing treatment for the remaining 25% of the sewage generated from the northern and southwestern parts of the Hong Kong Island, which routed through a tunnel to reach the Stonecutters Island for centralised treatment.  The programme has significantly improved the water quality of Victoria Harbour and safeguard public health.

In 2001, the Urban Renewal Authority was set up to replace the Land Development Corporation, and the first Urban Renewal Strategy was promulgated. The Urban Renewal Authority has streamlined the land assembly procedures and allocated resources more effectively to rehouse affected tenants.

image.description: Establishment of the Urban Renewal Authority

text.content: In 2002, the first three buildings in Hong Kong Science Park commenced operation, and the statutory body Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation is responsible for the operation and management of the Park and other facilities. There are five technology clusters in the Park, viz. Biomedical Technology, Electronics, Green Technology, Information and Communications Technology, and Material and Precision Engineering.

gallery.reference: Source: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation
Source: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation
Source: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation

text.content: In 2002, the Cyberport project was completed to facilitate the development of information and communication technologies (ICT) in Hong Kong. Leveraging on the advanced ICT infrastructure, the Cyberport focuses on building key clusters of digital technology, which include FinTech, eCommerce, IoT/Wearables, and Big Data/AI.

The amendments to the Town Planning Ordinance were to streamline the plan making process, promote transparency of the planning approval process for more opportunities for public engagement.  In addition,  enforcement control against unauthorised developments was strengthened, and efficiency of the Town Planning Board enhanced.

In 2004, the Harborfront Enhancement Committee, the precedent of the Harbourfront Commission, was set up. Based on sustainable development principles, the Committee advises the Government on the planning, land uses and developments along the existing and new harborfront of Victoria Harbour.

In 2004, Hong Kong's first large-scale underground stormwater storage tank was completed.  It was situated under the Tai Hang Tung rugby pitch and football pitch, with a capacity of 100 000 cubic metres, and capable of handling rainstorms with a 50-year return period. Other flood prevention strategies and works include stormwater pumping stations, stormwater drainage tunnel systems, bypass floodway and storm drains, etc.

In 2006, Ngong Ping 360 commenced operation.  It provides a cable ropeway to and fro Tung Chung and Ngong Ping, with a total length of 5.7 km, and is the longest bi-cable ropeway in Asia. The Ngong Ping tourism project is encompassing the religious heritage in Lantau, and its nearby attractions include the Big Buddha, Po Lin Monastery, and W政府新聞處om Path.

In 2007, the Government promulgated the "Hong Kong 2030 Planning Vision and Strategy". With an overarching goal for sustainable development, it recommended balancing conservation and development, creating a sense of place, creating quality living environment, regenerating rural areas, bolstering the economy, and anchoring Hong Kong's position in the region.

image.description: Hong Kong 2030 Planning Vision and Strategy

text.content:
In 2007, aiming to strike a balance between development and heritage conservation, the Government launched the "Revitalising Historic Buildings Through Partnership Scheme" to let
non-profit organisations submit applications for revitalising government-owned historic buildings. The aim of the Scheme is to preserve historic buildings and put them into good and innovative use.

image.description: Revitalising Historic Buildings Through Partnership Scheme

text.content:
In 2009, Hong Kong Geopark was designated as a National Geoparks of China, and was accepted as a member of the Global Geoparks Network in 2011. In 2015, it was renamed as "Hong Kong UNESCO Global Geopark". Located in the eastern part of Hong Kong, the Park includes the Sai Kung Volcanic Rock Region and the Northeast New Territories Sedimentary
Rock Region.

In 2010, the Government set up the Harborfront Commission to play an advocacy, oversight and
pro-active advisory role in the envisioning, planning, urban design, development, marketing, branding, management and operation of the harbourfront areas, their adjacent waters within the harbour limit and associated facilities on a continuous and ongoing
basis, etc.

In 2011, the Airport Authority published the "Hong Kong International Airport Master Plan 2030", which proposed to reclaim 650 hectares to develop the
Three-Runway System. The project commenced in 2016. Upon its completion, the practical maximum annual capacity is forecast to be about 620 000 air traffic movements per year.

gallery.reference: Source: Chief Secretary for Administration’s Office

text.content: In 2011, the Government announced the "Revised Urban Renewal Strategy", which proposed a “People First, District-based, Public Participatory” approach for urban renewal so as to balance the interests and needs of various stakeholders.

In 2011, the Government completed the Urban Design Study for the New Central Harborfront and proposed to an urban design framework to enhance the area spanning from the Central Piers to the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre with a view to creating a vibrant, attractive, accessible New
Central Harborfront.

image.description: Urban Design Study for the New Central Harborfront

text.content: In 2012, the Energizing Kowloon East Office formed by multi-disciplinary professionals was established to steer, supervise, oversee and monitor the development of Kowloon East with a view to facilitating its transformation into another premier CBD of Hong Kong to support her economic growth and strengthen her global competitiveness.

In 2013, the Kai Tak Cruise Terminal commenced operation to leverage on the rapid growing trends and opportunities in the global and regional cruise industry, and to consolidate Hong Kong's position as the premier cruise centre in the region. The terminal is about 850 m in length, and can berth world-class cruise liners up to 110,000 tons of gross displacement and 220 000 volume tons.

The Government released the "Railway Development Strategy 2014", initially recommending the implementation of seven new railway schemes between 2018 and 2026, including the Northern Link, Kwu Tung Station, Hung Shui Kiu Station, Tung Chung West Extension, East Kowloon Line, South Island
Line (West Section), North Island Line, and Tuen Mun South Extension.

The government announced the Long Term Housing Strategy (LTHS) in 1987, 1998, and 2014. The 2014 LTHS set out three strategic directions for building more public rental housing units, supplying more subsidised <nobr>sale flats, and stabilising the residential property market.</nobr>

In 2014, the government successively planned new development areas and extension of new towns, including the reclamation works of Tung Chung New Town Extension Project, which began in 2017 and 2019. The land formation works in the Kwu Tung North and Fanling North New Development Areas and in Hung Shui Kiu/Ha Tsuen have also started.

image.description: New Development Areas and New Town Extension

text.content: In 2016, the Hong Kong Maritime and Port Board was established to set the direction for the long-term development of Hong Kong's port and maritime services, foster the development of maritime manpower, and devise promotion strategies and initiatives to enhance Hong Kong's status as an international maritime centre.

image.description: Hong Kong Maritime and Port Board

text.content: In 2017, the Government announced "Hong Kong's Climate Action Plan 2030+", which set a new carbon intensity target - to reduce carbon intensity by 65% ​​to 70% by 2030 from the 2005 level. The Plan proposed a series of action plans, including more common and larger-scale adoption of renewable energy.

In 2017, the Hong Kong SAR Government and the Shenzhen Municipal People’s Government signed the "Memorandum of Understanding on Jointly Developing the Lok Ma Chau Loop" to support Hong Kong's innovation and technology industry.  Both parties will join hands in developing the Loop as "Hong Kong/Shenzhen Innovation and Technology Park".

image.description: Hong Kong-Shenzhen Innovation and Technology Park in the Loop

text.content: In 2017, the Government announced the "Hong Kong Smart City Blueprint", with initiatives for the next five years in six major areas: “Smart Mobility”, “Smart Living”, “Smart Environment”, “Smart People”, “Smart Government” and “Smart Economy”, which aspired to build Hong Kong as a smart city.

In 2018, the O · PARK1 located in Siu Ho Wan on North Lantau Island officially commenced operation. This is Hong Kong's first organic resource recovery centre, which adopts anaerobic digestion technology to convert food waste into biogas for electricity generation. It is capable of handling 200 tonnes of food waste per day, saving the valuable space in landfills.

In 2018, the Hong Kong section of the
Guangzhou-Shenzhen-Hong Kong Express Rail Link was inaugurated, with a total length of about 26 km. It runs from Hong Kong West Kowloon Station and routes through a dedicated tunnel to Shenzhen Futian Station and Guangzhounan Station to connect with the national high speed rail network. In 2018, the
Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge was completed and commenced operation to support closer economic cooperation between Hong Kong SAR and the Mainland.

image.description: High Speed Rail and Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge

text.content: In 2019, the State officially announced the “Outline Development Plan for the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area”. The objectives are to further deepen cooperation amongst Guangdong, Hong Kong and Macao, fully leverage the composite advantages of the three places, facilitate in-depth integration within the region, and promote coordinated regional economic development with a view to developing an international <nobr>first-class bay area ideal for living, working and traveling.</nobr>

The Liantang/Heung Yuen Wai Port commenced operation in 2020, providing a more efficient
cross-boundary passage between Hong Kong and Shenzhen East, Huizhou and Guangdong East.

The "Hong Kong 2030+: Towards a Planning Vision and Strategy Transcending 2030" puts forward the development strategies in face of the new challenges in future - enhancing liveability in a compact high-density city; embracing new economic opportunities and <nobr>challenges; and creating capacity for sustainable growth.</nobr>

sections.text1: 十九世紀中至第二次世界大戰爆發前，香港主要沿維多利亞港發展，以港島的「維多利亞城」為中心，其後逐漸拓展至九龍及新九龍。 1939年，香港訂定《城市規劃條例》，奠定在城市規劃發展時可依據的法律及機制基礎。
sections.cover: 十九世紀中至第二次世界大戰爆發前，香港主要沿維多利亞港發展，以港島的「維多利亞城」為中心，其後逐漸拓展至九龍及新九龍。 1939年，香港訂定《城市規劃條例》，奠定在城市規劃發展時可依據的法律及機制基礎。

text.content: 1860年，政府開始建造全港第一個水塘 — 薄扶林水塘，利用薄扶林谷的地勢，以水壩收集雨水後供應港島使用，工程於1863年完工。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1869年，政府在上環普仁街撥出土地，興建香港第<nobr>一間華人醫院 — 東華醫院。1872年，醫院落成啟用，</nobr>為貧苦市民提供免費中醫藥服務。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 香港歷史博物館

text.content: 1890年，香港電燈有限公司在灣仔永豐街旁的山坡地段，興建了全港第一間發電廠，為中區至上環文咸東街一帶的電街燈提供電力。1919年，北角發電廠啟用，灣仔發電廠轉作後備用途，直至1922年關閉並拆卸。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1906年，九廣鐵路（英段）工程展開，並於1910年開通，這是連接香港和中國內地的第一條鐵路，全長35公里，包括5條隧道和48條橋樑。1911年，
廣九鐵路（華段）開通，九龍往廣州的直通車開始營運。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館

text.content: 1912年，華人何啟和區德合組公司，於九龍灣填海並計劃興建樓房，該填海區便以公司名稱「啟德」<nobr>命名。後來，公司因經濟衰退倒閉，填海土地閒置，</nobr>政府便購回土地興建機場。1930年，香港啟德機場啟用。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館

text.content:
1939年，政府頒布《城市規劃條例》。條例授權城市規劃委員會有系統地擬備和核准香港各地區的布局設計及適宜在該等地區內建立的建築物類型的
圖則，以及為擬備和核准某些在內發展須有許可的地區的圖則而訂定條文，以促進社區的衞生、安全、便利及一般福利。城市規劃發展藍圖。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

sections.text1: 戰後發展充滿挑戰，政府委派顧問為香港制定了第一份長遠的發展策略。五十年代初，大量內地移民來港，對住屋的需求大增。石硤尾發生的大火促使政府興建首批公營房屋，改善生活環境。
sections.cover: 戰後發展充滿挑戰，政府委派顧問為香港制定了第一份長遠的發展策略。五十年代初，大量內地移民來港，對住屋的需求大增。石<nobr>硤尾發生的大火促使政府興建首批公營房屋，</nobr>改善生活環境。

text.content: 二戰後，政府重新規劃界限街以南的九龍區發展：尖沙咀為商業及文化中心，中部何文田山為住宅集中地，西面油麻地和大角嘴預留為高密度住宅區及工業區，設有公共設施如醫院、消防局等。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1947年，工務司署成立城市設計組，專責城市規劃事宜。經過多次的部門更迭後，1990年，政府把分散的規劃職能合併，成立規劃署，負責擬備各類
圖則、制定土地用途指引，以及為城市規劃委員會提供服務。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: <nobr>1948年，政府顧問亞柏康比發表《初步規劃報告書》。</nobr>這是香港首份具備發展策略的規劃藍圖，針對缺乏土地以及人口不斷增加兩大難題，提供了具體建議。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1953年聖誕夜，石硤尾寮屋區發生大火，超過53,000人無家可歸。為解決房屋問題，政府著手興建徙置大廈安置災民和其他寮屋居民。1954年底，首八幢徙置大廈（第一型）於石硤尾落成，是為第一批公共房屋。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 二戰後，香港的經濟重心從轉口貿易轉為輕工業。1954年，觀塘開始發展為香港第一個衛星城市，區內包含了工業區和住宅區，安置急增的人口之餘，亦為鄰近的工業區提供了勞動力。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館

sections.text1: 製造業於五、六十年代發展蓬勃，政府進一步發展基礎設施，包括獅子山隧道、東江水工程等。至七十年代，政府推出「十年建屋計劃」，大量興建公共房屋及發展新市鎮，並持續擴展運輸網絡。1979年地下鐵路投入服務，標誌着集體運輸系統的開始。
sections.cover:
製造業於五、六十年代發展蓬勃，政府進一步發展基礎設施，包括獅子山隧道、東江水工程等。至七十年代，政府推出「十年建屋計劃」，大量興建公共房屋及發展新市鎮，並持續擴展運輸
網絡。1979年地下鐵路投入服務，標誌着集體運輸系統的開始。

text.content:
1963年，香港食水短缺問題嚴重。政府與廣東當局協議興建東江—深圳供水工程，第一期工程於1965年完成。東江水從80多公里外流入雁田水庫和深圳水庫，再經3公里長的鋼管，到達香港邊境的木湖抽
水站。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1967至1978年間，位於港島南區的華富邨分階段
落成。華富邨是香港第一個以自給自足社區概念規劃的公共屋邨，邨內設有商場、學校、巴士總站，以及其他社區配套設施。

image.description:
首個自給自足的
公共屋邨

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府檔案處歷史檔案館
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1972年，政府宣布「十年建屋計劃」，並於1973年成立香港房屋委員會，接管所有徙置大廈及政府廉租屋邨之餘，亦肩負起推展公營房屋計劃的責任。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1948年的《初步規劃報告書》已提出興建海底隧道聯繫香港和九龍的城市核心，並加強核心區的對外（新界區）交通，擴張市區範圍。1972年，位於維港中部的第一條海底隧道 — 紅磡海底隧道正式
通車。1989年及1997年，第二條和第三條海底隧道亦相繼通車。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
香港發展為區內運輸及物流樞紐，建基於其優越的地理位置及作為通往珠江三角洲的門戶角色。
1972年，葵涌貨櫃碼頭的一號貨櫃碼頭投入運作。1976年，擴展至五號貨櫃碼頭。1997年前，六號至八號貨櫃碼頭亦相繼落成。葵涌貨櫃碼頭現有九個
碼頭，每年能處理超過2,000萬個標準貨櫃箱。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1973年，政府展開新市鎮發展計劃，第一代新市
鎮 — 荃灣、沙田和屯門於七十年代初動工。第二代新市鎮是大埔、粉嶺／上水及元朗，第三代則是將軍澳、天水圍和東涌。2019年，九個新市鎮的整體人口約352萬。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1976年頒布的《郊野公園條例》，為設立郊野公園及海岸公園委員會提供了法律根據，並規管郊野公<nobr>園和特別地區的指定、管制和管理。《郊野公園條例》</nobr>連同1995年頒布的《海岸公園條例》為保護香港郊野及海洋自然生態立下里程碑。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1978年，香港第一個工業邨 — 大埔工業邨落成，邨內提供已經開發完備的工業用地，給予未能在多層工廠或商業大廈內運作，以及擁有新型或經改良技術的公司使用。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
香港自60年代開始經濟不斷發展，城市發展的壓力也不斷增加。1965年，政府開始編制《土地利用計劃書》，全面檢討香港長遠的土地用途和人口
分布。其後，政府因應當時的社會經濟情況和發展優先次序，大幅度修訂上述計劃書，並於1979年重新命名為《香港發展綱略》。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1979年，為現時觀塘綫一部分的第一期修正早期系統通車，地下鐵路開始分階段投入服務，標誌著香港快速集體運輸系統的開始。2007年，地下鐵路公<nobr style="width:26vw;display: block;">司和九廣鐵路公司合併為香港鐵路有限公司（港鐵）。</nobr>

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 港鐵公司
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 港鐵公司
資料來源: 港鐵公司

sections.text1: 八十年代末，香港機場核心計劃推出，為往後數十年的機場、交通網絡及市區發展奠定重要基礎。城市核心與新界西及大嶼山緊緊連接起來。九十年代初通過「都會計劃」，以主要公路和鐵路為骨幹。1998年，赤鱲角香港國際機場投入服務，讓香港的經濟發展可更上一層樓。
sections.cover: 八十年代末，香港機場核心計劃推出，為往後數<nobr>十年的機場、交通網絡及市區發展奠定重要基礎。</nobr>城市核心與新界西及大嶼山緊緊連接起來。九十年代初通過「都會計劃」，以主要公路和鐵路為骨幹。1998年，赤鱲角香港國際機場投入服務，讓香港的經濟發展可更上一層樓。

text.content: 1984年，政府發表《全港發展策略》，就1991至2001年土地及交通發展提供框架。發展重點從以往新市鎮轉移至到維港兩岸都會區，並以公路和鐵路構成的網絡為城市發展的骨幹。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1987年，政府頒布《土地發展公司條例》，並於1988年成立土地發展公司，以審慎商業原則運作，推行市區重建計劃，並推動私人發展商以公私合營的模式參與市區重建。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 市區重建局

text.content: 1989年，政府宣布《港口及機場發展策略》，為本<nobr>港港口及機場的整體發展定下長遠的規劃大綱。相關</nobr><nobr>項目包括香港機場核心計劃（又稱「玫瑰園計劃」），</nobr>選址大嶼山赤鱲角興建全新的香港國際機場。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: <nobr>1990年，規劃署成立，隸屬當時的規劃環境地政科。</nobr>規劃署集中過往由城市規劃處、發展策略組，以及拓展署屬下的各拓展辦事處負責的規劃功能，肩負起使香港成為更美好的安居樂業地方的使命。
《1991年城市規劃（修訂）條例》生效，加強了規劃署的執行管制權力。規劃署獲授權在發展審批地區內對違例發展採取管制行動，避免新界鄉郊的環境受到進一步破壞。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 1995年，米埔及內后海灣約1,500公頃濕地正式列為拉姆薩爾濕地。這片濕地對遷飛候鳥非常重要，是牠們從北極圈俄羅斯遷飛至澳洲期間的過冬棲息地和補給站。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 漁農自然護理署

text.content: 1995年，政府頒布《海岸公園條例》，目的在於保<nobr>護和護理海洋環境及種類繁多的海洋動植物。1996年，</nobr>政府劃定位於東部水域的海下灣海岸公園和印洲塘海岸公園。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 漁農自然護理署

text.content: 1997年通過及其後修訂的《保護海港條例》訂明，旨在藉設定不准在海港內進行填海工程的推定，以達致保護和保存海港的目的。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: <nobr>1997年，政府展開《香港二十一世紀可持續發展研究》，</nobr>制訂「可持續發展」的定義和指標，並提出建議的政府組織架構，促使政府的決策過程納入「可持續發展」的考慮因素。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
1996年，政府完成《全港發展策略檢討》，並於1998年發表報告，提出研究新界西北部、新界東
北部、港島南部和南丫島的發展潛質，應付不斷增加的房屋需求。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

sections.text1: 在全球經濟新趨勢下，本港面對新挑戰。2007年政府發表《香港2030：規劃遠景與策略》，建議規劃策略集中於提供優質生活環境、提升經濟競爭力、以及加強與內地的聯繫。 展望將來，使香港將成為更宜居，更具競爭力及可持續發展的「亞洲國際都會」。
sections.cover:
在全球經濟新趨勢下，本港面對新挑戰。2007年政府發表《香港2030：規劃遠景與策略》，建議規劃策略集中於提供優質生活環境、提升經濟競
爭力、以及加強與內地的聯繫。展望將來，使
香港將成為更宜居，更具競爭力及可持續發展
的「亞洲國際都會」。

text.content: <nobr>1986年，政府制定污水排放策略和「污水收集整體計劃」。</nobr><nobr>2001年，「淨化海港計劃」的第一期污水處理設施投入運作；</nobr>第二期甲項目亦於2015年啟用，將餘下港島北部及西南部的污水，經由隧道輸往昂船洲污水處理廠中央處理。計劃顯著改善維港水質，保障公眾健康。

image.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2001年，市區重建局成立，取代土地發展公司，同年頒布首份《市區重建策略》。市區重建局簡化了土地徵集程序，並更有效地運用資源安置受影響的住宅租戶。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 市區重建局

text.content: 2002年，香港科學園首三幢大樓啟用，由法定機構香港科技園公司負責運作和管理園區和其他多項設施。園內五大科技群組為生物醫藥、電子、綠色</br>科技、資訊及通訊科技，以及物料與精密工程。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 香港科技園公司
資料來源: 香港科技園公司
資料來源: 香港科技園公司

text.content:
2002年，數碼港項目落成，旨在支持和推動香港資訊及通訊科技的發展。數碼港具備先進完善的資訊科技和電訊基建設施，集中發展的數碼科技範疇
包括：金融科技、電子商貿、大數據和人工智能等。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 香港科學園
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
是次修訂加快了制訂圖則的過程，提高了審批規劃許可程序的透明度，讓公眾人士有更多機會參與
其中。此外，亦加強執法，管制違例發展，以及提高城市規劃委員會的運作效率。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 香港科學園

text.content: 2004年成立的共建維港委員會，為海濱事務委員會前身。該委員會根據可持續發展的原則，就維多利亞港現有和新海旁的規劃、土地用途和發展，向政府提供意見。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2004年，香港首個大型地下蓄洪池完工，設於大坑東欖球場和足球場地下，容量為十萬立方米，可抵禦50年一遇的暴雨。其他防洪策略和工程包括興建雨水泵房、雨水排放隧道系統、排水繞道和雨水
渠等。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2006年，昂坪360正式通車，提供來往東涌及昂坪的索道服務，全長5.7公里，是亞洲最長的雙繩索纜車系統。昂坪整個旅遊項目融合了大嶼山的宗教文<nobr>化，鄰近景點包括天壇大佛、寶蓮禪寺和心經簡林。</nobr>

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: <nobr>2007年，政府公布《香港2030：規劃遠景與策略》，</nobr>在可持續發展的總體目標下，建議平衡保育及發展、創造地方特色、締造宜居社區、復修鄉郊地區、促進經濟發展和鞏固香港在區內的地位。

2007年，政府為在發展和保育文物兩者之間取得
平衡，推出了「活化歷史建築伙伴計劃」，讓非牟利機構申請活化政府歷史建築。計劃目的為保存歷史建築，並以創新的方法予以善用。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2009年，香港地質公園成為中國國家地質公園，2011年加入世界地質公園網絡，並於2015年更名
為「香港聯合國教科文組織世界地質公園」。位於香港東部的地質公園包含西貢火山岩及新界東北沉積岩兩個園區。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2010年，政府成立海濱事務委員會，旨在構想、
規劃、城市設計、發展、市場推廣、品牌建立、管理及營運海濱用地、海港範圍內鄰近水域及相關設施方面，持續無間地擔當倡導、監察及積極的諮詢角色等。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 海濱事務委員會
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2011年，香港機場管理局發表《香港國際機場2030規劃大綱》，建議填海650公頃，發展機場三跑道
系統。工程於2016年展開。建成後，預計機場每年實際最高跑道容量約為62萬架次。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政務司司長辦公室
資料來源: 香港機場管理局

text.content: 2011年，政府公布經修訂的《市區重建策略》，提出採用「以人為先，地區為本，與民共議」的方針進行市區更新工程，務求在重建過程中平衡各方的利益和需要。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2011年，政府完成了中環新海濱城市設計研究，提出了改善中環碼頭至香港會議展覽中心一帶的城市設計大綱，目標是締造一個朝氣蓬勃、綠化和暢達的中環新海濱。

image.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2012年，起動九龍東辦事處正式成立，由多個不同界別專業人士組成，負責引領、督導、監督和監察九龍東的發展，將之轉型為另一個核心商業區，以支持香港的經濟增長和加強香港在全球的競爭力。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2013年，啟德郵輪碼頭啟用，以充分利用全球及區內郵輪業迅速增長的趨勢和機遇，並鞏固香港作為區內首要郵輪中心的地位。碼頭全長約850米，可以供排水量達11萬噸、總噸位達22萬噸的世界級郵輪停泊。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 政府公布《鐵路發展策略2014》，初步建議於2018至2026年期間推展七個新鐵路方案，包括北環線及古洞站、洪水橋站、東涌西延線、東九龍線、南港島線（西段）、北港島線和屯門南延線項目。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 運輸及房屋局

text.content: 政府先後於1987年、1998年及2014年公布長遠房屋策略。2014年公布的《長遠房屋策略》，就加建公共租住房屋和資助出售單位，以及穩定私人住宅物業價格，提出了三大策略性方向。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2014年，政府陸續規劃新發展區和擴展原有新市鎮，包括於2017年和2019年開始東涌新市鎮擴展計劃的填海工程。古洞北及粉嶺北新發展區的土地平<nobr>整工程和洪水橋／廈村的土地平整工程亦相繼動工。</nobr>

image.description:
新發展區和
擴展新市鎮

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2016年，香港海運港口局正式成立，為港口及海運<nobr>服務業訂定長遠發展方向、推動業界人力資源發展，</nobr>及制定推廣策略和措施，以提升香港的國際海運中心地位。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2017年，政府公布了《香港氣候行動藍圖2030＋》，訂立新的碳強度目標 — 以2005年為基準，於2030年把碳強度降低65%至70%。藍圖提出了一系列行動
計劃，包括更廣泛和具規模地採用可再生能源等措施。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 2017年，香港特區政府和深圳市人民政府簽署了《關於港深推進落馬洲河套地區共同發展的合作備忘錄》，為支持香港的創科業，雙方將合作發展河套地區為「港深創新及科技園」。

image.description:
河套地區創新及
科技園發展

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2017年，政府公布了《香港智慧城市藍圖》，
就「智慧出行」、「智慧生活」、「智慧環境」、「智慧市民」、「智慧政府」和「智慧經濟」六個範疇，提出未來五年的措施，推動香港發展為智慧城市。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2018年，位於北大嶼山小蠔灣的O · PARK1正式投入運作。這是香港第一所有機資源回收中心，採用了厭氧分解技術將廚餘轉化為生物氣以作發電，每天可處理200公噸廚餘，減少佔用寶貴的堆填區
空間。

image.description:
第一所有機
資源回收中心

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 環境保護署
資料來源: 環境保護署
資料來源: 環境保護署
資料來源: 環境保護署

text.content:
2018年，廣深港高速鐵路香港段通車，全長約26
公里，由香港西九龍站開始，經過專用隧道至深圳福田站及廣州南站，並連接國家整個高鐵網絡。2018年，港珠澳大橋落成並啟用，以配合香港特區和內地緊密的經濟合作。

image.description: 高速鐵路及港珠澳大橋

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處
資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
2019年，國家正式公布了《粵港澳大灣區發展規劃綱要》，目標是進一步深化粵港澳合作，充分發揮三地綜合優勢，促成區內的深度融合，推動區域經濟協同發展，建設宜居、
宜業、宜遊的國際一流灣區。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content:
蓮塘／香園圍口岸於2020年開通，為香港與深
圳東、惠州和粵東之間提供更有效率的跨境通道。

gallery.reference: 資料來源: 政府新聞處

text.content: 《香港2030＋：跨越2030年的規劃遠景與策略》就著應對未來的新挑戰，提出三大發展策略：規劃宜居的高密度城市、迎接新的經濟挑戰與機遇和創造容量以達致可持續發展。
